intro: Helicteres brasiliana, commonly known as the Brazilian helicteres, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Helicteres brasiliana is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some areas.
